FacilityName: Paynesville Farmers Union Coop Oil Co.

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PAYNESVILLE FARMERS UNION COOP OIL CO.

P.O.BOX 53

PAYNESVILLE, MN 56362

320-243-3751



A. Introduction

Paynesville Farmers Union Coop Oil is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, seed and other inputs to farmers. Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers. This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to RMP covered process. Paynesville Farmers Union Coop Oil Co has had 1 incident in the past 5 years.

B. Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program

This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire and re-hire employee and at least every three years as required by OSHA. The anhydrous ammonia tank (s) and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies. 

C. Emergency Response Plan/ Emergency Action Plan

Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency plan policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings. This facility has an Emergency Action Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency practices and procedures. The Emergency Action Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Action Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are sent a notification annually identifying hazardous chemicals on the property and are invited for a tour on a regular basis.

D. Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario

This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-c

ase scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.

E. Five Year History

This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP covered process. Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.

F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Management of this company and facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Monthly safety inspections are conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.

G. Summary

The employees of this company are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safety facility environment for the public, our customers and
